intro: Lesquerella occidentalis var. parvifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Brassicaceae, also known as the mustard family. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain oily seeds, which are used in various industrial applications. This variety is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid environments.
